meanings.definition: To encourage or provoke someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: She egged her friend on to try the new roller coaster.
meanings.sent2: The coach egged the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel egged the birds to sing louder.
meanings.sent4: His curiosity egged him to explore the mysterious cave.
meanings.sent5: The supportive crowd egged the performer to continue singing.

meanings.definition: To throw eggs at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The kids egged the house on Halloween night.
meanings.sent2: Protesters egged the politician's car during the rally.
meanings.sent3: The prankster egged his own car for a laugh.
meanings.sent4: The angry mob egged the building in protest.
meanings.sent5: The vandals egged the statue in the park.
